defs: (Jain.) the attainment of certain superhuman powers.
a movement or movements collectively, of the body or of part of the body, to express or emphasise ideas, emotions, etc, in a drama staged, but not including delivery of dialogue.
(mus.) one of the four old classifications of musical modes (but, opinions differ about the exact nature of this; however, this is now obs.).
(used in pl.) funeral rites and ceremonies.
one who argues that the human body is meant only for action (karma).
an agreement between two or more people to do something; a contract.
a beginner in learning something; a novice; a new student.
that which causes a work happen; an active force or substance producing an effect; an agent.
the time of an action; the proper time for performing a rite.
having or showing skill; accomplished; expert; skilful.
a man who is very skilful or highly trained and informed in some special field.
a woman whois very skilful or highly trained and informed in some special field.
a failing to accomplish (something); such a failure.
(rhet.) a figure of speech, in which the verb or verbal clause is suggested indirectly or to be understood though not plainly expressed.
= ಕ್ರಿಯಾಋದ್ಧಿ.
(rhet.) a figure of speech in which a verb, though present in a sentence, remains unobserved or is not obvious.
the act or an instance of doing, working, performing; performance.
awareness or knowledge of action being or to be done.

functional; active - a) that is acting, functioning, working, moving, etc.; b) capable of acting, functioning, etc.; c) causing action, motion or change; d) characterised by much action or motion; lively, busy, agile, quick, etc.
(gram.) a word that indicates or includes the sense of an action.
the quality of a) acting, functioning, working, moving, etc.; b) being capable of acting, functioning, etc.; c) causing action, motion or change.
education that prepares students' attitude towards the practicalities, practical application, etc. (instead of being mere academic).
(gram.) any indeclinable that partakes of the nature of a verb.
(vīr.) a formal initiation of a person by his preceptor into Vīraśaiva religion.
prejudice of a witness towards the cause.
a witness whose testimony is prejudicial to the cause.
a performing of an action disinterestedly with the attitude that the Supreme Being is the actual doer, but not oneself.
an agent that brings a thing into being or initiates a change.
a giving up of what one has to do; abandonment of one's action.
characterised by much action or motion; lively, busy, agile, quick, etc.; active.
an active, agile, responsive person or thing.
any of a class of words expressing action, existence or occurrence; a verb.
the improvement of efficiency by a) giving different parts of a manufacturing process etc. to different people, b) dividing the job among different people; division of labour.
that part of āgamas (auxiliary scriptures to Vedas) that deal with the procedures to be followed in worshipping a God or gods.
(law) the third division of a legal plain, that is, witnesses, documents and others proofs adduced by the plaintiff or complainant.
that which is following, adhering to, the rules of scriptures.
following, adhering or as per, the rules of scriptures.
the fundamental element of a verb, exclusive of all affixes and inflections; a root-verb.
consequence of an act; anything brought about by an action.
(vīr.) holy ashes formally given by a preceptor to his disciple.
= ಕ್ರಿಯಾಪಾದ.
a person or animal that is engaged in actions and undergoing the effects thereof without understanding or analysing the process.
the illusion of action, one of the factors that bind the soul to the worldly, non-spiritual affairs.
that has failed in one's duties.
not being grateful, thankful; ungrateful.
a man who has failed in his duties.
a man not feeling thankful or grateful.
a woman whohas failed in her duties.
a woman not feeling thankful or grateful.
(Jain.) a hymn that is capable of bringing results.
an action that is performed with a purpose; a deliberate action.
the path of action (as diff. from paths of yoga or knowledge).
a series of actions (to be performed in a successive order).
a table containing different forms (with inflections and affixes) of each verb.
performance of actions, worldly and religious rites, without having desire for the results.
the part of yoga practice which uses procedures requiring effort.
a type of yoga which employs ritual as one of the techniques.

a hard preliminary stage requiring adoption of the ascetic way of life dedicated study of the scriptures, etc. in order to prepare oneself for the higher stage of meditative absorptions leading to the realisation.
(in modern phil.) an incorporating into one's working life, principles compatible with the goal, thereby progressing in one's regular meditative sessions.
the employment of expedients or means.
(gram.) connection with the verb.
that which is able to be put into practice, to be effected, accomplished or done; practicability.
a set of facts, principles, rules, etc. classified or arranged in a regular orderly form in showing a logical plan linking the various parts; system.

(vīr.) manifestation of the deity in the state of material body, being one of the three degrees of manifestation (cf. ಪ್ರಾಣಲಿಂಗ, ಭಾವಲಿಂಗ).
(gram.) a desired gender.
the action or an act of neglecting or failing to perform something, esp. a duty.
omission, non-observance or discontinuance of any of the essential religious ceremonies.
a violating of a set procedures, rules or custom (esp. in the conduct of legislative meetings); point of order.
characterised by much action or motion; lively, busy, agile, quick, etc.; active.
an active, agile, responsive man.
a man who is grateful, thankful.

the act or fact of performing ceremonies of a religion or one's duties.
operation - a) the condition of being in action or at work; b) a process or action that is part of a series in some work.
a word used to indicate the occurrence of or performance of an action or the existence of a state or condition, connecting the subject of a sentence with the rest of the predicate; a verb.

a particular or special work, job or action.

the tendency, quality of being active, diligent, industrious.
one who knows the rules of action, manner of any rite.

any act of reparation, self-punishment, etc. done in repentance for a sin or wrong doing; penance.

an extract or the essence, flavour, etc. produced of by boiling; a decoction.
= ಕ್ವಾಥ.
= ಕ್ವಾಥ.
copper sulphate; green vitriol.
a metric unit of weight, equal to 100 kilograms (220.46 lbs.); a quintal.
= ಕ್ವಿನೀನು.
a bitter, crystalline alkaloid, extracted from cinchona (Cinchona succirubra) bark; quinine.
a man who, by his nature, can tolerate, endure or forbear.
the compound of consonants, 'ಕ್ಷ'.

a band of electromagnetic radiation with wavelengths between gamma rays and ultraviolet radiation, produced by the bombardment of a substance (usu. one of the heavy metals) by a stream of electrons moving at great velocity, as in a vacuum tube, capable of penetrating opaque or solid substances, ionizing gases and body tissues through which they pass or, by extended exposure, destroying tissue, and affecting photographic plates and fluorescent screens, used in diagnosis, and treatment of certain organic disorders, esp. of internal structures of the body; x-ray.
(fig.) a deep, probing examination, going beyond what is apparent.
a photograph made by means of X-rays.
a measure of time equal to forty eight seconds.
a very short period of time; moment; instant.
free, unoccupied time during which a person may indulge in rest, recreation, etc.; leisure; free-time.
a right, proper or auspicious moment.
that which chiefly engages one's time; (one's) trade, profession or business; occupation.
a time or day of feasting or celebration; a joyous occasion; a festival; a festival occasion.
the middle, central portion of (anything).
the condition or fact of being dependent upon or controlled by another; dependence.
a condition of being very low in position, status, quality, etc.
the condition of a slave, serf or the like; subjection to a master; slavery or bondage; servitude.
ಕ್ಷಣ ಚಿತ್ತ, ಕ್ಷಣ ಪಿತ್ತ kṣaṇa citta, kṣaṇa pitta the quality or condition of a person who changes his opinion or reverses his own thought, without reason, frequently; fickleness.
a series of afflicting, distressing or impeding incidents or occasions, occurring very frequently.
= ಕ್ಷಣಪ್ರಭೆ.
a person moving, functioning or active during the night; a devil; an evil spirit; a demon.
= ಕ್ಷಣದಾಚರ.
the period of actual darkness after sunset and before sunrise; night.
the act or an instance of hurting, injuring.
a killing; murder.
a position, status, etc. that lasts for a very short period.
a sudden, brief light; a flash; a lightning.
(fig.) a sudden, brief display of thought, understanding.
that which lasts for a very short period; an ephemeral thing.
= ಕ್ಷಣಭಂಗವೃತ್ತಿ.
short-lived; transitory; of a passing nature; not enduring or permanent; temporary, fleeting or ephemeral; transient.
the quality or fact of being temporary, fleeting, ephemeral or not enduring; transitoriness.
for a moment or short period; temporarily; momentarily.
= ಕ್ಷಣಪ್ರಭೆ.
(Jain.) a man who is extremely quiet and unperturbed by external affairs.
